verses.kjv: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some others, epistles of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you?
verses.web: Are we beginning again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as do some, letters of commendation to you or from you?
verses.ct: Are we starting to promote ourselves again? Do we need letters of recommendation to you or from you, like some people do?

verses.kjv: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:
verses.web: You are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read by all men,
verses.ct: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as ye are manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.
verses.web: being revealed that you are a letter of Christ, served by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tablets of stone, but in tablets that are hearts of flesh.
verses.ct: It's clear that you are a letter from Christ, delivered through our ministry — written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on the living tablets of human hearts.

verses.kjv: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:
verses.web: Such confidence we have through Christ toward God,
verses.ct: This is the kind of confidence we have before God through Christ.

verses.kjv: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;
verses.web: not that we are sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God,
verses.ct: It's not that we're capable of doing any of this on our own — our ability comes from God.

verses.kjv: Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.
verses.web: who also made us sufficient as servants of a new covenant, not of the letter, but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
verses.ct: He's the one who made us capable servants of a new covenant — not based on the written law, but on the Spirit. The written law brings death, but the Spirit gives life.

verses.kjv: But if the ministration of death, written and engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which glory was to be done away:
verses.web: But if the service of death, written engraved on stones, came with glory, so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his face, which was passing away,
verses.ct: Now, the ministry that brought death — its laws carved into stone — came with such glory that the people of Israel couldn't even look at Moses' face because it was shining so brightly, even though that glory was already fading.

verses.kjv: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?
verses.web: won’t service of the Spirit be with much more glory?
verses.ct: So how much more glorious is the ministry of the Spirit?

verses.kjv: For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.
verses.web: For if the service of condemnation has glory, the service of righteousness exceeds much more in glory.
verses.ct: If the ministry that brought condemnation had glory, the ministry that brings righteousness overflows with even greater glory.

verses.kjv: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.
verses.web: For most certainly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasses.
verses.ct: In fact, what once seemed glorious has lost its glory entirely when compared to the glory that far surpasses it.

verses.kjv: For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is glorious.
verses.web: For if that which passes away was with glory, much more that which remains is in glory.
verses.ct: If what was fading away came with glory, what remains forever carries an even greater glory.

verses.kjv: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:
verses.web: Having therefore such a hope, we use great boldness of speech,
verses.ct: Since we have this kind of hope, we speak with complete boldness.

verses.kjv: And not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:
verses.web: and not as Moses, who put a veil on his face, that the children of Israel wouldn’t look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away.
verses.ct: We aren't like Moses, who put a veil over his face so the people of Israel couldn't watch the glory fade away to nothing.

verses.kjv: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.
verses.web: But their minds were hardened, for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remains, because in Christ it passes away.
verses.ct: But their minds were blinded. To this very day, when the old covenant is read aloud, that same veil remains — and it's only removed through Christ.

verses.kjv: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.
verses.web: But to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.
verses.ct: Even now, whenever the writings of Moses are read, a veil covers their hearts.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.
verses.web: But whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.
verses.ct: But whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

verses.kjv: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
verses.web: Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
verses.ct: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

verses.kjv: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the LORD.
verses.web: But we all, with unveiled face seeing the glory of the Lord as in a mirror, are transformed into the same image from glory to glory, even as from the Lord, the Spirit.
verses.ct: All of us, with unveiled faces, see the glory of the Lord as if reflected in a mirror — and we are being transformed into that same image, from one degree of glory to the next, by the Lord, who is the Spirit.
